english: to travel; to roam; to wander; to swim

etymology.description: 游: semantic 水 “water” + phonetic 斿; 遊: semantic 辵 “walk” + phonetic 斿.
etymology.interpretation: Traditional highlights overland movement with 辵, while simplified uses the water radical to evoke motion in water. The phonetic 斿 supplies the yóu sound and also evokes a fluttering streamer, reinforcing the idea of roaming or moving about.
etymology.simplification: Replaced 辵 with the water radical 氵 to reduce strokes and emphasize the ‘swim’ sense, while retaining the phonetic 斿; a semantic-substitution simplification.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢到处游玩(我喜歡到處遊玩)。
他在河里游得很快(他在河裡游得很快)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài hé lǐ yóu de hěn kuài.
examples.english: He swims quickly in the river.

examples.chinese: 周末我们去海边游泳(週末我們去海邊游泳)。
examples.english: On the weekend we go to the seaside to swim.
